node.title: PM on Omicron variant, traffic light system and vaccine passes
node.description: It's still early days with the Covid-19 Omicron variant, but the prime minister says our border settings have served us well so far and she's confident that so far, they are appropriate. Audio

node.title: A timeline of major events in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
node.description: Ghislaine Maxwell, a former girlfriend and longtime business associate of Jeffrey Epstein, was arrested nearly a year after his death.

node.title: Ari Lennox Accuses Amsterdam Airport Security of Racial Discrimination During Arrest
node.description: The R&B singer accused the Dutch airport of hating Black people in a series of tweets Monday.

node.title: Social Media Companies Fail at Curbing Spanish-Language Misinformation: Report
node.description: The report detailed how Facebook failed to flag 70 percent of COVID-19 misinformation written in Spanish compared to just 29 percent in English.

node.title: FedEx Driver Questioned After Hundreds of Packages Found in Alabama Woods
node.description: The Blount County Sheriff's Office first reported the incident last Wednesday when they said that "300-400 boxes of assorted sizes" were found in a ravine.

node.title: Auckland hospital projects delayed by fire concerns
node.description: Vital hospital building projects in Auckland are being delayed for months by questions over fire designs - and especially the safe evacuation of smoke-filled rooms.

node.title: Supreme Court prepares to hear biggest abortion fight in decades
node.description: Nearly 50 years after Roe v. Wade, the future of abortion rights will face its most consequential test Wednesday.

node.title: With Political Memes, the Medium Matters
node.description: Dissecting the visual aspects of the violent video circulated by Representative Paul Gosar.

node.title: Vegan Who Died of COVID 'Begged for the Vaccine' After Refusing It Due to Animal Testing
node.description: "The last thing Glynn said to me was 'I have never felt so ill, I wish that I had the vaccine,'" Glynn Steel's wife Emma said.

node.title: Woman Mocks Kendall Jenner's Wedding Attire in Video Viewed Over 4.6M Times
node.description: "Kendall said it's okay, Kendall said it's quite alright," one commenter joked about the "revealing" dress.

node.title: It's home to 37 government departments, but this tiny island's residents are still sick and homeless
node.description: Thursday Island is the administration centre of the Torres Strait, but underneath all that administration and bureaucracy residents say their lives are a daily struggle.

node.title: International students and visa holders urged to 'hang in there' for another two weeks as Omicron keeps borders closed
node.description: International students barred from entering Australia for at least another two weeks are being urged to "hang in there" after the federal government postponed its reopening plan in response to the new Omicron strain of COVID-19.

node.title: Have you asked for an Airbnb refund during COVID? Ross was refused one – and then told to break lockdown
node.description: A lack of regulation has created "buyer beware" situation where some people are being denied refunds for short-term rental bookings that they can't use during COVID. And this is lining the pockets of the head companies.

node.title: Singer Ari Lennox detained in Amsterdam after confrontation
node.description: Investigators were questioning Lennox over possible threats made to the staff member and security officer. They did not share the alleged threats.

node.title: Virgil Abloh, Ambassador and Infiltrator
node.description: Look around at the way young men now think about clothes, design and music, and you’ll see him everywhere.

node.title: Movie theaters must ‘urgently’ rethink the experience, a study says.
node.description: Nearly half of the prepandemic audience hasn’t returned, research shows, and 8 percent may be gone forever.

node.title: Japanese City is Frontrunner for 2030 Winter Olympics, Claims It Can Cut Costs of Event
node.description: Officials projected the 2030 Winter Olympics to cost between $2.5-$2.65 billion. The recent Tokyo Summer Olympics was $15.4 billion, but some think it was more.

node.title: UK Extends COVID Booster Shots, Speeds Up Wait for Doses as Omicron Cases Surface
node.description: The extension to all adults 18 and older will allow about 13 million more people to get the booster. So far, the U.K. has given about 17.5 million boosters.

node.title: Watch Lin-Manuel Miranda, Josh Groban Honor Late Stephen Sondheim in Times Square
node.description: The Broadway community gathered to pay tribute to the musical theater giant by singing Sondheim's "Sunday" from "Sunday in the Park with George."

node.title: Greg Abbott Gets Texas Border Wall Deal Amid Warning of Approaching Migrant Caravans
node.description: The announcement of the deal comes as a part of Abbot's June disaster declaration to construct a border wall to "provide safety for (Texas') citizens"

node.title: New challenges for tourism industry as Omicron variant emerges
node.description: The tourism industry is grappling with the prospect of its new normal being years away with billions of dollars lost by then and many more hurdles ahead - including its latest, the new Covid variant…

node.title: Biden says Omicron variant is "cause for concern, not a cause for panic"
node.description: "Sooner or later, we're going to see cases of this new variant here in the United States," he said.

node.title: De Blasio reminds New Yorkers to wear masks indoors.
node.description: “We’re doubling down” on current mask guidance, the mayor said. He also extended the city’s vaccine mandate to cover workers in child care settings and early intervention programs.

node.title: Scotland finds 6 cases of Omicron, but no sign its spread is ‘sustained.’
node.description: By Cora Engelbrecht

node.title: ‘No red flags’ yet: South African scientists caution against panic over the new variant.
node.description: Officials said that while they need more data to be sure, existing treatments and precautions seem to be effective against the Omicron variant.

node.title: Miss Universe Pageant Proceeding As Usual, Despite Competitor Testing Positive for COVID
node.description: The Miss Universe pageant will proceed on December 12 in Eilat, Israel, despite an unnamed competitor testing positive for COVID-19 upon arrival.

node.title: Most Omicron Cases in South Africa Have Mild Symptoms, COVID Shot Appears to Help: Doctor
node.description: The majority of infected individuals are between the ages of 20 and 30, are displaying mild symptoms and are being treated at home.

node.title: Man Leaves $2,000 Tip at Bakery for $5 Order
node.description: The bakery owner said the customer "got exceptional service and noticed there was a younger generation of people working hard."

node.title: As Gas Prices Stabilize Across Nation, Why Does California's Fuel Cost Continue to Rise?
node.description: The average cost of a gallon of gasoline in California was $4.71 on November 29, according to AAA.

node.title: What's it like to renovate in Antarctica? These expeditioners are about to find out
node.description: Below-freezing temperatures, gale force winds and penguins — it's what awaits expeditioners travelling to preserve the remains of Mawson's Huts in Antarctica.
